item.title: Xperience the Sony Ericsson Xperia X10
item.description:
The Xperia X10 might be the perfect smartphone you’ve been looking for. It boasts an 8.1 Megapixel camera and a 4-inch touchscreen, which begs the question: do you really need to carry a separate camera? The Xperia’s camera eliminates that need with features like flash, 16x zoom, touch focus, geo-tagging, smile detection, and a ‘send to web’ option. It’s adaptable for landscape, portrait, night, beach, and various other settings. You can even edit photos directly on the phone using apps from the Android Market...

item.title: Samsung Galaxy S III Supports Verizon 4G LTE
item.description:
The Samsung Galaxy S III for Verizon Wireless is a top-of-the-line smartphone with cutting-edge technology for both features and speed. This model continues the Galaxy series’ tradition of innovation. This Android smartphone uses the Google Operating System 4.0 “Ice Cream Sandwich” and features a 4.8-inch HD Super AMOLED display. With 1280 x 720 pixels, the screen displays sharp, vibrant images and text. The curved design helps prevent scratches, even when the phone is face down...

item.title: China's unicorn company has revealed the top 10 rankings in the Google Play store for its Wi-Fi crowdsourcing app
item.description:
Source: Play Store. The free app WiFi Master Key, which helps users find and connect to crowdsourced Wi-Fi hotspots, is gaining popularity in Southeast Asia. It helps people access the internet in a region where connectivity is rapidly expanding. The app lets users share Wi-Fi hotspot information with the community. While this information allows others to connect for free, the app prioritizes privacy and security by encrypting and storing shared Wi-Fi passwords in its cloud database instead of revealing them directly...

item.title: Phones become unresponsive due to Android vulnerability
item.description:
Trend Micro has identified a weakness in the Android operating system that can cause a phone to seem non-functional. Affected phones exhibit symptoms like no ringing or notification sounds, an inability to make calls, and an unresponsive screen. Additionally, locked phones cannot be unlocked. This vulnerability affects Android versions from 4.3 (Jelly Bean) to 5.1.1 (Lollipop), encompassing over half of all Android devices currently in use. Despite being reported to the Android Engineering Team in late May, no official fix has been released through the Android Open Source Project (AOSP)...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/phones-become-unresponsive-due-to-android-vulnerability/

item.title: In just minutes, Wondershare can transfer Blackberry data to other phones
item.description:
Switching from a Blackberry to a new phone? Wondershare might be the solution for you. Their updated MobileTrans software (Version 4.1) enables Blackberry users to move their data to other devices. This includes SMS messages, contact lists, call history, and other data. Source: Wondershare website Wondershare claims that MobileTrans is the first and only solution that can transfer Blackberry SMS messages to an iPhone. With this software and a Blackberry desktop backup, users can transfer data without connecting both their old and new phones to a computer...

item.title: The LG G3s will be the first to receive the Lollipop upgrade
item.description:
LG Electronics claims to be the first worldwide smartphone maker to launch the Lollipop update in 2014. According to LG, the updated Android operating system, Android 5.0 or “Lollipop,” will be available for its G3 smartphones starting in Poland the week of November 10, with other major markets following shortly after. Source: LG. This newest Android OS offers a variety of enhancements, including enhanced depth, shadows, and animations. With a fresh design and color scheme, notifications have been enhanced and will be visible on the new lock screen...

item.title: The HandySpeech app, which converts handwriting to speech, is now available on Android devices
item.description:
iSpeak4U, a company known for developing mobile apps for individuals with speech and hearing impairments, has launched an Android version of their app HandySpeech. This app offers a simple and efficient communication tool for those with speech difficulties. Source: iSpeak4U. HandySpeech running on various devices. With HandySpeech, users can input text on a device screen using their finger or a stylus, and the device will then vocalize the written words. The app is designed to store frequently used phrases and adapt to the user’s handwriting style...

item.title: Send Fax From Email On Your Computer or Smartphone
item.description:
Do you recall fax machines with thermal paper rolls? Those messages had a distinct look and tended to fade. To preserve them, you’d copy them onto regular paper using a laser printer, then diligently wash the strange residue off your hands. Fax technology has significantly evolved. Thermal paper is out, and even traditional fax machines are becoming rare. Cloud-based electronic transmission and storage are the modern alternatives. Sending and receiving faxes via email is the contemporary approach...

item.title: Google has introduced free Wi-Fi at Mumbai Central Station and launched the Indic keyboard app
item.description:
Source: Google Asia Pacific blog. Beginning January 22nd, individuals passing through Mumbai Central station in India will have access to complimentary, high-speed Wi-Fi provided by Google. This service is part of an initiative revealed in September 2015 to bring high-speed public Wi-Fi to 400 train stations across India. Collaborating with Indian Railways, which manages one of the world’s most extensive railway systems, and RailTel, a provider of internet services as RailWire through its fiber network along many railway lines, Google’s Access & Energy team aims to equip 100 of India’s busiest stations with Wi-Fi by the end of 2016, with the remaining stations to follow shortly after...

item.title: Trend Micro demonstrates ways to enhance the security of Android devices
item.description:
In 2014, Android controlled the global smartphone market, shipping one billion units and representing 81% of all smartphones shipped, as reported by Strategy Analytics. Trend Micro researcher, Paul Oliveria, points out that Android’s popularity stems from its affordability, efficient data storage, and availability across various brands and price points. This widespread use makes Android a prime target for hackers. To combat this, Trend Micro proposes seven security measures for mobile users:..

item.title: Doing BACKFLIPs with MOTOBLUR
item.description:
Would you do a backflip for your current cell phone? Probably not, but Motorola’s BACKFLIP might just change your mind. This phone’s unique feature is its reverse hinge. Unlike most phones where the keyboard is hidden beneath the screen, the BACKFLIP’s keyboard is located on the exterior, flipping open to reveal a full-size touchscreen. This design eliminates the need for a smaller internal screen, offering a more spacious keyboard and a high-resolution touchscreen experience comparable to a small computer...

item.title: Fixed Mobile Convergence Includes Android and iPhone
item.description:
Network convergence typically focuses on combining LAN, MAN, and WAN technologies to support various data types like voice and video. This convergence is key to the advantages offered by enterprise VoIP solutions, such as increased productivity and reduced costs. However, there’s often a missing link: mobile phones. This is where Fixed Mobile Convergence (FMC) comes in. Smartphones have become so essential that excluding them from corporate communication systems creates a significant gap...
